{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3329888,"name":"Owen Lee","username":"OwenLee4534","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/7bcc69/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T14:26:48.453Z","cooked":"

Our team used MK4 swerves, with the same NEO 1.0 motors for 3 years. How much does this really affect performance?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T14:27:36.566Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":258,"readers_count":257,"score":126.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":458242,"topic_slug":"how-much-does-motor-age-affect-performance","display_username":"Owen Lee","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60757,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-much-does-motor-age-affect-performance/458242/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3329895,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T14:34:46.205Z","cooked":"

In the real world for most teams?

It will not be noticeable.

Is there a difference between versions? Yes. But you will not see that difference in most usecases.

Edit: with the above I am referring to different versions of the motor. As stuff gets beat up ofer time it will lose some peak performance.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T14:49:38.011Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":243,"readers_count":242,"score":48.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":458242,"topic_slug":"how-much-does-motor-age-affect-performance","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/how-much-does-motor-age-affect-performance/458242/2","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3329908,"name":"ben gates","username":"banjogates","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/banjogates/{size}/251059_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T14:46:42.801Z","cooked":"

In 2022, 3357 had one NEO powering our intake rollers on what I think was a 2:1 belted reduction. Don’t remember the current limit, but there was a very obvious degradation in motor performance from our reveal to the bot’s retirement in October. Granted we were running that motor too hard, but motors can degrade noticeably over time.

For swerve with stock ratios, you should be fine.

I think the weakest part of the motors are the internal bearings. So it depends on the quality of the bearings. I would only use new motors on the powertrain.

Magnets can age – especially if subject to high temperatures and lots of mechanical shock. In FRC, this is not normally a consideration though.

All About Circuits

DC Motor Magnet Lifespan

Hello, I will be machining something similar to a DC motor but will only turn 180 degrees. I will have a coil in the centre and 2 magnets on the rotating piece. So my question is without considering wear and tear on everything but the magnets, how...
